result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Alan Seroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**8/21/2015 - JOC amended per Order filed August 3, 2015 to reflect Defendant is eligible to participate in the Wisconsin Department of Corrections' Earned Release Program as of March 27, 2017.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

Defendant to obtain/maintain full time employment or combination of employment and school equivalent to full time.

Employment to be in occupation approved by agent.

Defendant shall not voluntarily quit employment without his agent's approval.

Obey all rules and conditions established by Department of Corrections.

Comply with risk and needs assessments and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.

Comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow through with all programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Complete Department of Corrections CGIP program.

No contact with Cody Sheriff-Bruckert or his residence.

Follow all no contacts and rules ordered by agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence now serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
